Package sammish93.tbage.models

Class Feat

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.models.Feat
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Feat extends Object implements Serializable
This class is used by both the Player and the Encounter classes to add functionality that allow a developer to add feat checks and rewards to their own game permutation. One example of use includes custom code in the generic Useable interface lambda provided to the setOnInitiationBehaviour() to check to see if a specific feat is present in the encounter's feat check TreeMap, and then to check whether a player has obtained that feat, and thereafter alter the behavior based on this. Example: Useable onUseInitiation = (gameEngine) -> { var player = gameEngine.getPlayer(); if (player.getFeatFromFeats("TAKES_DAMAGE_FROM_RUSTY_NAIL_UPON_COMBAT_ENCOUNTER_ENTRY") == null) { player.subtractFromCurrentHealth(6); gameEngine.printMessage("On entering the encounter you suffered 6 damage from a rusty doornail!"); } else { gameEngine.printMessage("Thanks to your heightened agility from your mead-drinking antics, you manage " + "to skip past a precarious rusty doornail. That could have been deadly!"); } }; encounter.setOnInitiationBehaviour(onUseInitiation);
See Also:
  • Encounter.setOnInitiationBehaviour(Useable)

    • create

      public static Feat create()
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Feat object with a default UUID value as a name and a default isSecret value of false.

    • create

      public static Feat create(String name)
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this feat.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Feat object with a default isSecret value of false.

    • create

      public static Feat create(String name, boolean isSecret)
      Parameters:
      name - A string that is used as an identifier for this feat.
      isSecret - A boolean value that determines whether a feat is hidden or not from a player. Secret feats can be used to control behaviours that the developer may not intend to show to a player.
      Returns:
      Returns an initialised Feat object.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      Returns a string representing the name of this object. If no name is set then an UUID converted to a string will be returned.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Parameters:
      name - Sets the name of this object to a new string value.

    • isSecret

      public boolean isSecret()
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value of true if the feat is secret.

    • setSecret

      public void setSecret(boolean secret)
      Parameters:
      secret - Sets the boolean value of whether or not the feat is secret. If the feat is secret, then the player will not receive a message in the game interface upon receiving the feat.

    • save

      public void save(String path) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: feat.save("src/fileName");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • save

      public void save(String path, String fileExtension) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is decided by the developer.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: feat.save("src/fileName", "sav");
      fileExtension - The file type extension the developer wishes to save the file as.
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • load

      public static GameSettings load(String path) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is only required when the extension is something other than '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the file is located at. This can either be with or without the file extension. Examples: var feat = Feat.load("src/fileNameWithSavExtension.sav"); or var feat = Feat.load("src/fileNameWithSerExtension");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to. underscores, and forward slashes.
      ClassNotFoundException
